End of Three Truths prayer and beginning of Gospel Lesson according to John lacking; end of Passion according to John and beginning of Hours of the Virgin (including miniature) lacking
Saint Alexander added to calendar on 14 March (fol. 5r) in a sixteenth- or seventeenth-century hand

msIdentifier.collection: John Frederick Lewis Collection of European Manuscripts

msContents.summary: This Book of Hours of the Use of Paris was likely produced in Paris in the early sixteenth century. It begins with a calendar in French with four animal emblems in the margins (fols. 3r-14v). The following section is comprised of a prayer in French to the Three Truths ("les trois vérités," fol. 16v), the end of which is lacking. The majority of the Gospel Lesson according to John is missing (fol. 17r), and is followed by the passion according to John (fols. 17v-22r, end lacking, but introduced by a small miniature of the Agony in the Garden). The Hours of the Virgin follows, though it is lacking its beginning and its introductory miniature of the Annunciation. The remaining seven large miniatures depict the Visitation (fol 35r), Nativity (fol. 41v), Adoration of the Magi (fol. 45r), Presentation in the Temple (fol. 47v), Flight into Egypt (fol. 50r), Dormition (fol. 52v), and Coronation of the Virgin (fol. 56v). The Hours of the Virgin is followed by the Hours of the Cross, introduced by a large miniature of the Carrying of the Cross (fol. 60r). The subsequent Hours for this Office are each introduced on a new page. The Hours of the Holy Spirit is laid out in a similar fashion, introduced by a large miniature of the Pentecost (fol. 64r). The Penitential Psalms, Litany, and Prayers are introduced by a large miniature of David and Bathsheba with two attendants (fol. 68r). The Office of the Dead, which is followed by extensive accessory prayers and Suffrages, is introduced by a miniature showing a burial scene (fol. 80r) with the Last Judgment in the background. The Stabat Mater prayer is introduced by a small miniature (fol. 115v), as are the Suffrages to Saints John the Baptist and John the Evangelist (fols. 117v-118r). Further prayers have been added in a bâtarde hand on folios 131r-132r. The book contains three unidentified coats-of-arms in the margins, presumably belonging to the original owner (fols. 52v, 68r and 80r).

msItem.title: Book of Hours, use of Paris
Calendar, Use of Paris, in French
Prayer, "Les trois vérités," in French, end lacking
Gospel Lesson of John (beginning lacking), followed by Passion According to John (end lacking)
Hours of the Virgin, Use of Paris (beginning lacking)
Office of the Dead, followed by Prayers for a Man, for a Woman, for Parents, for the Dead, and for one's Friend

Prayers for the Deceased, Salvator Mundi, the Seven Verses of Saint Bernard, Omnipotens sempiterne Deus, Prayer to Christ on the Cross, Prayer for Communion, Prayers to the Virgin, Prayer of the Queen of Spain, Prayer for a Guardian Angel, and Blessings against a storm, for the King, for the grace of sinners, against the temptation of the flesh, for times of tribulation, for those who travel, for pregnant women, for diverse problems, and for the altar, Stabat Mater, and Suffrages, followed by Prayers in French to the Trinity, to the Virgin, to the Virgin after Easter, for Advent, and to the Holy Spirit
Suffrages for Saints Peter and Paul, Pope Sixtus IV, All Saints, and Saint Denis, in a different hand

supportDesc.extent: iii+133+iii; 177 x 120 mm bound to 186 x 133 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Modern foliation in pencil, recto, below lower right corner of text block

layoutDesc.layout: One column of eighteen lines, ruled in red ink, some prickings visible: written area: 112 x 75 mm

decoDesc.decoNote: Eleven full-page miniatures with borders containing animals and foliage, four half-page miniatures with foliate borders, four unframed animal and floral scenes added to the margins of the calendar, illuminated initials and line-fillers throughout
35rFull foliate border with bears and cat
41vFull foliate border with hedgehog, roosters, bird, and devil with shovel
45rFull foliate border with birds and moth
47vFull foliate border with birds and drollery
50rLarge miniature, Flight into Egypt with the fall of idols and the miracle in the cornfield
50rFull foliate border with birds and griffin
52vFull foliate border with ferret and dog
64rFull foliate border with bird, dog, and drollery
68rFull foliate border with birds and fox
80rLarge miniature, Burial Scene with Last Judgment
80rFull foliate border with birds and musical drolleries
115vBar border with single foliate margin, with griffin
117vSmall miniature, Beheading of Saint John the Baptist
117vBar border with single foliate margin, with drollery
118rBar border with single foliate margin, with bear
133rNotations in ink: "J de Charron de Liancourt chanione de L'Eglise Royalle de Saint Quentin en vermandois 1701"; "J.B Cartier [or Courtier?]... [effaced] 1789"

binding.p: English, brown morocco, blind-stamped decoration; stamped in gold on inside front cover; matching slipcase; bound by Zaensdorf, 1900

origin.p: Initials I, T, P, M, E, paired variously, in borders on several folios; unidentified coats-of-arms on fols. 52v, 68r and 80r; early sixteenth century

history.provenance: J. de Charron de Liancourt, Saint Quentin (1701) (inscription on fol. 133r); J.B. Cartier [or Courtier?] (1789) (inscription on fol. 133r); Theodore Newton Vail, late nineteenth.; sale, Anderson Galleries, New York, May 4, 1922, lot 685 (catalog clipping on fol. 133r); John Frederick Lewis, Philadelphia; given by his widow, Anne Baker Lewis, to the Free Library of Philadelphia in 1936; "J de Charron de Liancourt chanione de L'Eglise Royalle de Saint Quentin en vermandois 1701" on fol. 133r; inscribed "J.B. Carlier . . . 1789," on fol. 133r (Carlier was the curé of Bavai who died in 1818); Repeated use of the initials "P", "M", "T", "E" and "I" in various combinations, woven within love-knot design: fol. 35r, I and T; fol. 43r, I and E; fol. 45v, erased initial and T; fol. 49r, P and M; fol. 50v, P and M; fol. 54v, I E; fol. 60r, I and T, fol. 64r, I and T or A?; fol. 68r, P; fol. 80r, I and E, P and T, and I and T
